alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:37PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and northwestern Kane Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 337 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Henrieville to 11 miles southwest of Bryce Canyon National Park to 7 miles south of Hatch. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryce Canyon National Park, Tropic, Cannonville, Alton and Long Valley Junction. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 101 and 110. Utah Route 12 between mile markers 21 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
